title: Patna High Court: Patna High Court Orders Green Initiative on Ara-Mohania Highway with Rs 2.5 Crore Sapling Plantation | Patna News - Times of India
text: Patna: Patna high court on Thursday directed the mines and geology department to ensure plantation of saplings on both the flanks of national highway (NH)-319 on Ara (Bhojpur district)-Mohania (Kaimur) stretch, by utilising Rs 2.5 crore, collected as export premium charges on inter-state sand trading.A single bench of Justice Rajiv Roy, while hearing a contempt plea of a mining company, ordered constitution of a three-member committee to monitor and ensure that saplings are planted with wooden fencing on both the sides of the NH stretch for sustainable growth, and report it to the court. The committee, headed by advocate Naresh Dixit, special prosecutor for mines department in the high court, will comprise advocate Suraj Samdarshi and an administrative officer from the mines department. On August 10 last year, Justice Roy, while disposing of a writ petition, had directed the principal secretary of the mines and geology department to utilize the proceeds of the export premium charges in making the NH green by the end of January 2024.We also published the following articles recentlyEx-Director of Mines and Geology VG Venkata Reddy arrested by ACB in Rs 2,566 crore scam; charged with criminal conspiracy and breach of trustVG Venkata Reddy, former Director of Mines and Geology, has been arrested by the Anti-Corruption Bureau for alleged irregularities resulting in significant financial losses to the public exchequer.
